prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A pianist who can't play a lick. Formerly an ace defense attorney of some renown.
Character 1
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: Future star magician, and Phoenix Wright's daughter. Fond of her Mr. Hat trick.
Character 2
Name: Klavier Gavin
Description: Star prosecutor and leader/vocalist for the rock group, the Gavinners.
Character 3
Name: LeTouse
Description: Lamiroir's interpreter. His first name is "Romein".
Character 4
Name: Lamiroir
Description: Singer lauded as the "Siren of the Ballad", from the tiny country of Borginia.
Character 5
Name: Machi Tobaye
Description: Lamiroir's favorite pianist. He is blind.
Character 6
Name: Ema Skye
Description: Detective obsessed with forensics. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 7
Name: Daryan Crescend
Description: Guitarist for the Gavinners. His day job is as a detective in Criminal Affairs, Div. 3.
Character 8
Name: Valant Gramarye
Description: Famous magician, often on TV. Fond of exaggeration.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.
Evidence 1
Name: Postcard
Description: Lamiroir's own publicity postcard. Click here for details.
Evidence 2
Name: Lyrics Sheet
Description: Contains the lyrics to Lamiroir's ballad. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Investigation Request
Description: Information concerning the crime to be restricted to police and related parties.
Evidence 4
Name: Brooch
Description: Found at the crime scene. Seems strangely familiar... Found at the crime scene. Turns out it belongs to Lamiroir.
Evidence 5
Name: Revolver
Description: The murder weapon.  A deadly, high-caliber revolver. The murder weapon. A deadly, high-caliber revolver belonging to Mr. LeTouse.
Evidence 6
Name: Key Ring
Description: Mr. LeTouse died clutching this. Note the heart-shaped ring. Found in the victim's left hand. Holds keys to a guitar case and a motorcycle.
Evidence 7
Name: Mixing Board
Description: Allows music to be played in separate tracks. Click here to use.
Evidence 8
Name: LeTouse's Autopsy Report
Description: Death due to loss of blood from a gunshot wound. Est. time of death: 9:00-9:30 PM.
Evidence 9
Name: Crime Photo
Description: Victim shot in shoulder in Lamiroir's room. [caption] The victim was lying head down on the floor, his face turned to the left. There is smeared writing in blood on the floor in front of his head next to his right hand.
Evidence 10
Name: Diagram
Description: The crime scene was Lamiroir's dressing room. [caption] Observing from the door, the victim was blocked from sight by items. There was a gun next to the victim's body. Two bullet holes were found on the wall where the door was.
I... looked into the room. Just a glance, mind you.
Evidence 11
Name: Video Tape
Description: Taped recording of Lamiroir's performance. Click here for details.
Evidence 12
Name: Headset
Description: Retrieved from Backstage Hallway. Receiver/transmitter for voice signals. All concert staff wore one. Receiver/transmitter for voice signals with a 30-foot range. All concert staff wore one.
Evidence 13
Name: Switch → Remote Trigger
Description: Found on the stage. It's a switch for something, and that's about all I know. Found on the stage. Triggers an igniter. Use with caution. Found on the stage. Triggers an igniter within 30 feet.
Evidence 14
Name: Forum Diagram
Description: Cross-section diagram of the Sunshine Coliseum. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Igniter
Description: Found at the crime scene. Emits a flame when triggered by remote control. Identical igniters in Gavin's guitar and at the crime scene. Triggered by "Remote Trigger".
Evidence 16
Name: Borginian Newspaper
Description: Article about the case. It doesn't mention the lyrics of Lamiroir's ballad.
Evidence 17
Name: Prosecutor Gavin's Guitar
Description: A gift from Lamiroir, sent from Borginia. Burned the night of the concert.
Evidence 18
Name: Replica
Description: Replica of something, held by Mr. LeTouse. Apparently the focus of his investigation. Borginia Cocoon replica, held by Mr. LeTouse. Replica of a cocoon from which a remedy for "incuritis" may be extracted.
Evidence 19
Name: Newspaper Article
Description: Article about the Chief Justice's son, who is inflicted with "incuritis".
Evidence 20
Name: Burnt Fragments
Description: Found at the crime scene, bearing a gunpowder residue. Possibly a firecracker?

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: As for what I saw... I saw nothing.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 1
Testimony: That night, I was invited to sing on stage, and this I did.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 2
Testimony: I did not return backstage after the second set.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 3
Testimony: When my performance was finished, I went backstage for just a moment...
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 4
Testimony: I saw nothing. The late Mr. LeTouse's body was behind a wall.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 5
Testimony: I saw bullet holes in the wall, and knew Mr. LeTouse had been shot...
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 6
Testimony: Then I was led by the police to Mr. Gavin's dressing room, and told to wait there.
Person: Lamiroir
Testimony 7
Testimony: That was where I learned that something had happened... But I wasn't told the details.
Person: Lamiroir

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let me try to work through this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let me start by going through each testimony and see what evidence might conflict with it.

First, looking at the testimonies from Lamiroir:

Testimony 0: "As for what I saw... I saw nothing."  
Testimony 1: "That night, I was invited to sing on stage, and this I did."  
Testimony 2: "I did not return backstage after the second set."  
Testimony 3: "When my performance was finished, I went backstage for just a moment..."  
Testimony 4: "I saw nothing. The late Mr. LeTouse's body was behind a wall."  
Testimony 5: "I saw bullet holes in the wall, and knew Mr. LeTouse had been shot..."  
Testimony 6: "Then I was led by the police to Mr. Gavin's dressing room, and told to wait there."  
Testimony 7: "That was where I learned that something had happened... But I wasn't told the details."

Hmm, Testimony 2 and 3 might be conflicting with each other? Testimony 2 says he didn't return backstage after the second set, but Testimony 3 says he went backstage for a moment after finishing the performance. But that's within his own testimonies, so maybe not relevant here since we need evidence vs testimony.

Looking at the evidence:

Evidence 9: Crime Photo description mentions the victim was lying head down, with smeared writing in blood on the floor next to his right hand. The caption also mentions two bullet holes on the wall where the door was. 

Evidence 10: Diagram says that when looking into the room, the victim was blocked from sight by items, and there was a gun next to him. Two bullet holes on the door wall. The witness (maybe Lamiroir?) only glanced and couldn't see the body because it was behind items.

Testimony 4 says Lamiroir saw bullet holes in the wall and knew LeTouse was shot, but according to Evidence 10's diagram, the bullet holes were on the door's wall. If the body was blocked from view, how did Lamiroir see the bullet holes unless he was in the room? Wait, Testimony 5 says he saw bullet holes and knew about the shooting. But according to the diagram (Evidence 10), the bullet holes are on the door wall. If Lamiroir was in the hallway and just glanced in, maybe he could see the door's wall with the bullet holes but not the body behind items. So that might not be a contradiction.

Wait, Testimony 5 says he "saw bullet holes in the wall" but according to Evidence 10, the bullet holes are on the door's wall. If he was in the hallway, he might have seen the door with bullet holes, so that's possible. However, the testimony says he went backstage for a moment (Testimony 3) after finishing the performance. If he was there, maybe he could see the bullet holes from inside the room.

Another angle: Testimony 4 says the body was behind a wall, so Lamiroir couldn't see it, but he could see the bullet holes. That's consistent with Evidence 10's description. Hmm, maybe not a contradiction here.

Looking at Testimony 5: He saw bullet holes and knew LeTouse was shot. But according to Evidence 8 (Autopsy Report), the cause of death was a gunshot wound. So that's consistent.

Wait, maybe looking at Evidence 9's crime photo caption: there's smeared writing in blood on the floor next to the victim's right hand. If Lamiroir saw nothing (Testimony 0 and 4), but the crime scene has writing, maybe someone else could have written it, but that's not directly a contradiction.

Another testimony: Testimony 3 says he went backstage for a moment after finishing his performance. But if the time of death is around 9 PM (Evidence 8), and when did his performance end? Not sure yet.

Wait, looking at Evidence 11: Video Tape of Lamiroir's performance. If the video shows her not going backstage, that could contradict Testimony 3. But the evidence description just says it's a taped recording; I don't know the content. Maybe the video shows her going backstage, but that's not specified here.

Evidence 12: Headset found in the hallway. All staff wore them with 30-foot range. If Lamiroir had one, maybe she could have communicated, but not sure.

Evidence 13: Remote trigger found on stage, which can trigger an igniter within 30 feet. The igniter (Evidence 15) is found at the crime scene and in Gavin's guitar. Maybe related to a fire, but not directly conflicting with testimonies yet.

Evidence 17: Gavin's guitar was sent from Borginia and burned. The igniter in the guitar might have been used in the crime. But how does that relate?

Looking at Testimony 5, Lamiroir says he saw bullet holes and knew LeTouse was shot. But according to Evidence 5, the revolver belongs to LeTouse. If he was shot with his own gun, maybe that's a clue, but not a contradiction.

Wait, Evidence 5 says the revolver is LeTouse's. So if LeTouse was shot with his own gun, maybe he was the shooter? But the testimony says he was the victim. Hmm, but the testimony is from Lamiroir, so maybe she didn't know that. Not a contradiction here.

Another angle: Testimony 2 says he didn't return backstage after the second set, but Testimony 3 says he went backstage after finishing the performance. If the second set was the end of his performance, then Testimony 2 and 3 conflict, but that's within his own statements, so not evidence vs testimony.

Looking at Testimony 0 and 4 where he says he saw nothing. However, Evidence 9's crime scene has blood writing. If Lamiroir was there, maybe he could have seen that, but he claims he saw nothing. But the blood writing might be part of the crime scene that's not visible from outside. 

Wait, Evidence 10's diagram says the victim was blocked from sight by items when viewed from the door. So Lamiroir, if he just glanced in, wouldn't see the body but might see the bullet holes on the door's wall. But the blood writing on the floor next to the body would also be blocked. So his testimony that he saw nothing except bullet holes is possible.

Hmm, perhaps Testimony 5 where he says he saw bullet holes and knew about the shooting is consistent with Evidence 10's bullet holes on the door. 

Wait, maybe Evidence 9's crime photo shows that the victim was lying head down, with blood writing next to his right hand. If Lamiroir saw nothing (Testimony 4), but the blood writing exists, maybe someone else left it. But Lamiroir's testimony doesn't address that specifically, so maybe not a contradiction.

Wait, let's look at Evidence 10's description again. The caption says: "I... looked into the room. Just a glance, mind you." The observer (maybe Lamiroir?) saw the bullet holes but not the body because it was blocked. But Testimony 5 says Lamiroir saw the bullet holes and knew about the shooting. That's consistent. 

Another possibility: Testimony 3 says he went backstage for a moment after finishing the performance. If the time of death was 9 PM (Evidence 8), and his performance ended before that, then maybe he was there around the time. But without more info, not sure.

Looking at Evidence 16: Borginian Newspaper article doesn't mention the lyrics of Lamiroir's ballad. But Evidence 2 is the lyrics sheet. If the newspaper article didn't mention it, but the lyrics exist, that's not a contradiction unless someone testified about the lyrics being in the article.

Alternatively, Testimony 0 says he saw nothing, but Evidence 2's lyrics might be part of the crime's context. Not sure.

Wait, looking at Evidence 4: the brooch found at the scene belongs to Lamiroir. If she was there, but she testified she didn't go backstage (Testimony 2), that could be a contradiction. Let's see:

Testimony 2: "I did not return backstage after the second set."  
If the brooch (Evidence 4) is hers and found at the crime scene (backstage), that would mean she was there, contradicting Testimony 2. That seems like a solid contradiction.

Yes! Because if the brooch belongs to Lamiroir and was found at the crime scene (backstage), that implies she was there, but she testified she didn't return backstage after the second set. So Evidence 4 contradicts Testimony 2.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a contradiction between one evidence and one testimony. The user has given me a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. My goal is to identify a pair where an evidence contradicts a testimony.

First, let me go through each testimony and see what they claim, then check the evidences to see if any contradict those claims.

Starting with Testimony 0 by Ema: "I believe Machi stole the body because of some lyrics." The evidence related to lyrics is Evidence 2, the Lyrics Sheet. But I don't see a direct contradiction here yet. Testimony 1 says the body was moved to match Lamiroir's song. Evidence 9 is the Crime Photo, which shows the victim's position. If the testimony claims the body was moved, but the Crime Photo might indicate the original position, maybe there's a contradiction there. But I need to check details.

Testimony 2: "No one in this country had a motive to kill the victim." The country mentioned is Borginia, since Lamiroir is from there. Evidence 18 mentions the Replica of a Borginia Cocoon, which was part of LeTouse's investigation. If LeTouse was investigating the Replica related to incuritis (as per Evidence 19 and 20?), maybe someone from Borginia did have a motive. But I need to check if the evidence shows a Borginian's motive. The Brooch (Evidence 4) belongs to Lamiroir, a Borginian. If Lamiroir had a motive related to the cocoon, that could contradict Ema's testimony that no one in the country had a motive. But I need to see if any evidence points to Lamiroir's motive.

Testimony 3: "Machi practically left his signature at the scene." Evidence 5 is the Revolver belonging to LeTouse. If Machi is blind, how would he leave a signature? Maybe the evidence shows that the murder weapon was LeTouse's, so if Machi used it, but the testimony says he left a signature, perhaps the weapon's ownership contradicts that? Not sure yet.

Testimony 4: "All evidence points to the defendant (Machi)." But if the Revolver is LeTouse's (Evidence 5), and if LeTouse was the victim, maybe the gun was his, so if Machi used it, but maybe there's another angle. Alternatively, the Burnt Fragments (Evidence 20) might relate to the guitar (Evidence 17) which was a gift from Lamiroir. If the guitar was burned, maybe that's linked to someone else.

Testimony 5: "From the state of the crime scene, I conclude the shooter was blind." Machi is blind (Character 5's description). So this testimony supports that Machi could be the shooter. But Evidence 5's revolver: if the murder weapon was LeTouse's, and if Machi is blind, could he have used a revolver? Maybe the testimony's conclusion that the shooter was blind aligns with Machi being the defendant. But does any evidence contradict this?

Wait, the key might be in Testimony 5: Ema says the shooter was blind, which would support Machi as the shooter since he's blind. But is there evidence that contradicts that conclusion? Let me check the crime scene details. Evidence 9's caption mentions the victim was shot in the shoulder, and there's blood smeared writing. If the shooter was blind, how would they aim? Maybe the position of the body or the shot's accuracy contradicts that. Alternatively, the testimony says the shooter was blind, but the evidence might show that the shot was precise, which a blind person couldn't do. Wait, the Autopsy Report (Evidence 8) says death due to a gunshot wound to the shoulder. A shoulder wound might not require precise aim, but maybe the angle or something else. Alternatively, the Revolver is a high-caliber weapon, but that doesn't directly contradict being blind. Hmm, maybe I'm missing something here.

Looking back at Testimony 2: Ema says no one in Borginia had a motive. Evidence 19 is a newspaper article about the Chief Justice's son with incuritis. The Replica (Evidence 18) is about a cocoon that could cure incuritis. If LeTouse was investigating this, maybe someone from Borginia (like Lamiroir) had a motive related to protecting the cocoon's secret or something. If Lamiroir had a motive, then Ema's testimony that no Borginian had motive would be contradicted by Evidence 18 and 19.

Alternatively, Testimony 0 mentions lyrics. The Lyrics Sheet (Evidence 2) contains the lyrics. If the lyrics reference moving a body, but the Crime Photo (Evidence 9) shows the body's position, maybe there's a contradiction there. But without knowing the lyrics' content, it's hard to say. The Borginian Newspaper (Evidence 16) doesn't mention the lyrics, which might be relevant but not a direct contradiction.

Wait, Testimony 5 says the shooter was blind. Evidence 5 is the revolver belonging to LeTouse. If Machi is blind, how did he use a revolver? Maybe the testimony's conclusion is based on the crime scene suggesting the shooter was close, but a blind person might have a different method. Alternatively, maybe the presence of the Headset (Evidence 12) or the Remote Trigger (Evidence 13) suggests the shooter used a different method, like a remote trigger, which a blind person could manage. But that might support the testimony rather than contradict it.

Another angle: Testimony 2 says no Borginian had motive. Evidence 4 is the Brooch found at the crime scene belonging to Lamiroir (a Borginian). If Lamiroir was involved, that would contradict Ema's statement. But Lamiroir's testimonies (previous ones) say he didn't return backstage, etc. So maybe the Brooch being at the scene (Evidence 4) suggests Lamiroir was there, implying a motive, contradicting Ema's Testimony 2.

Yes, that seems plausible. Ema claims no one from Borginia had a motive, but Evidence 4 shows Lamiroir's Brooch was at the crime scene, indicating he was present, which could imply he had a motive or was involved, contradicting Testimony 2.

Alternatively, Testimony 2 is by Ema, and the contradiction would be between Evidence 4 and Testimony 2. Let me confirm:

Testimony 2: "No one in this country had a motive to kill the victim." (Ema)

Evidence 4: Brooch belonging to Lamiroir (a Borginian) was found at the crime scene. This suggests Lamiroir was present, possibly indicating he had a motive, which contradicts Ema's statement that no Borginian had a motive.

Therefore, the pair would be Evidence 4 and Testimony 2.
</think>
